website_summaries.verdict: This cajon stands out for its sound and attractive multi-wood design.
pros: Sound is a balance between a traditional and Flamenco cajon
Beautifully handcrafted from a variety of hardwoods
Nice sound with a booming bass
Comes with a padded gig bag
cons: While the bass gets lots of praise, some feel the snare is too subtle

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound and quality!
customer_reviews.text: I visited a local store to test out their selection of Meinl, Pearl and Schleigworks cajons. Bottom line, I only liked one and it was the $400 Meinl Artisan. After some online research I came across very positive reviews of Sol. It took blind faith for me to buy sight unseen and unheard but I jumped. The first time I played it I was in love. The sound is pure with resonate bass and crisp slaps. There is no bleed over of the snare in the bass, a problem many other models had. The craftsmanship is superb! It looks amazing and for the price with a gig bag is unbeatable. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Construction is very good with nice dovetails and beautiful finish
customer_reviews.text: A high quality product. Construction is very good with nice dovetails and beautiful finish. Different color woods and patterns make for an attractive Cajon. Sound is very good with nice booming bass. Slaps sound good with the high slap adjustable by loosening the corner screws. High slap has a nice 'snap' to it. Padded gig (carry) bag is good quality with an attractve logo. One backpack strap and two carry cloth handles. Overall very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lazir Asyab

customer_reviews.title: The El Artesano cajon is a work of art
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautifully built piece to add to one's percussion ensemble. I had to fight off the guitar players, because they kept taking breaks to look at it. Everybody loved the mellow sounds, too. Well worth the money, *and* it comes with a padded carry bag!
customer_reviews.author: Don Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Great Cajon!
customer_reviews.text: This cajon is great if you like a low-end sound... Has snares, but pretty subtle. Excellent quality and looks gorgeous.
customer_reviews.author: Rick, Gallup, NM

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful sound. Beautiful instrument
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves this!! Plays it all the time. Beautiful sound. Beautiful instrument!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Molder

customer_reviews.title: Best Cajon on the market for an incredible price
customer_reviews.text: This Cajon is well made with beautiful inlay and sounds great. Just excellent quality. Others that have played it have been Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: GJH

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drum! Beautiful to look at, beautiful to hear, beautiful to play. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Doctormyeyes

customer_reviews.title: A fine sounding cajon
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this Cajon. Not only is it like a fine handcrafted piece of furniture but it sounds great too. Deep rich base tones and a nice slap
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bolivar

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: Great Sound and beautiful to play. I was borrowing one from a friend to play in the worship and praise service and this on sounds so much better. It is beautifully crafted. The sound is amazing and I am encouraged in my new found talent.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: very nice cajon! High quality construction
customer_reviews.text: Very, very nice cajon! High quality construction, much more so than many of the big name brands. And the sound completely blows away any of the big names I've played. This is a High Quality instrument at a very fair price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous in SO Many Ways!
customer_reviews.text: Just LOOK at it! It's beautiful. It sounds great. I love it. Get one - you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Jude Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Wonderful Sounding Cajon.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this. I am playing every night. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: This is a beautiful instrument with great tone
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful instrument with great tone. My some was a little disappointed that the snares are not as loud as he hoped, but otherwise he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: libertymom4

customer_reviews.title: It is beautiful and sounds great.
customer_reviews.text: It is beautiful and sounds great. My new favorite instrument!
customer_reviews.author: Edward J Moler

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was almost all bass and not much snare. I returned it for a Meinl.
customer_reviews.author: Rick G.

customer_reviews.title: I have never been disappointed by the sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased the new Sol Percussion "El Artesano" cajon. I have never been disappointed by the sound quality, workmanship, innovation and design that Sol has always demonstrated since their inception in San Francisco 20+ years ago. The sound of this Peruvian made cajon is incredible! This is only the beginning for Sol Percussion. Check them out you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Zuniga

customer_reviews.title: Guitar strings or snare wires???
customer_reviews.text: Quick question... this cajon uses guitar strings to produce the snare sound???
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Sol products are first class!
customer_reviews.text: I've had Sol cajons, congas and bongos since 2004. Sound and quality of workmanship are second to none and they are also a great company to do business with. Akbar the owner and designer is really interested in talking to musicians and making instruments that work for them. Every aspect of each of their products is carefully thought through, tried, modified and perfected.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Mark Williams

product_meta.title: A Tempo Percussion El Artesano Cajon with Free Bag
product_meta.description: A Tempo Percussion's El Artesano Cajon is made by A Tempo in Peru, a country considered by most to be the birthplace of the cajon as an instrument. The body of this cajon is made from select pieces of solid Mohena, American Muskwood and Tropical Walnut with a multi-ply Spanish Cedar and Lupuna playing surface and resonant side. El Artesano Cajon features snare wires designed and placed to reduce their sound when playing the bass tone without sacrificing any snap on a slap tone. The result is a cajon that balances the best sonic characteristics of both a traditional cajon and a Flamenco cajon. Free gig bag included!
feature_bullets: El Artesano is a cajon that balances the best sonic characteristics of both a traditional cajon and a Flamenco cajon. It has a warm, booming bass as well as a snappy slap tone.
To achieve this balance, this cajon features snare wires designed and placed to reduce their sound when playing the bass tone without sacrificing any snap on a slap tone.

Artisans painstakingly create the panels for the body of the cajon by selecting and using individual pieces of hardwood. Once the panels are created, the cajon is built using dovetail joints and then finished in a durable satin finish.
Crafted by hand in Peru by A Tempo Percussion, this cajon is the exact same cajon as Sol Percussion El Artesano - only the logo has changed.
